questions.question: What is the empirical formula of UiO-68-BTMB?
What method was used for the synthesis of mixed linker UiO-68-L/dTPDC?
questions.answer: The same method as UiO-68-L, with different ratios of L and dTPDC used for the synthesis.

questions.question: How was the photoluminescent spectra recorded?
questions.answer: The photoluminescent spectra were recorded on FLS1000 spectrofluorometer (Edinburgh Instruments).

questions.question: What was the purpose of using a mixed-linker strategy in the synthesis of UiO-68-NTMB and UiO-68-NSMB?
questions.answer: The mixed-linker strategy was employed to increase the distances between the emissive linkers, aiming to improve the quantum efficiency by reducing the aggregation-caused quenching effect.

questions.question: Is the crystal system of UiO-68-BTMB cubic?
Did the synthesis of UiO-68-L/dTPDC involve the use of ZrCl4 and benzoic acid?
Was the PXRD pattern of UiO-68-NTMB/dTPDC identical to that of simulated UiO-68?
What was the effect of increasing the concentration of dTPDC on the PLQY of UiO-68-NTMB/dTPDC?
questions.answer: Increasing the concentration of dTPDC led to a significant improvement in the PLQY, demonstrating a 62.6 times enhancement from 0.30% to 18.8%.

questions.question: What was the role of dTPDC in the mixed-linker MOFs?
questions.answer: dTPDC acted as a nonemissive linker to increase the distances between the emissive linkers, effectively reducing the nonradiative decay channels caused by aggregation.

questions.question: Was the synthesis of UiO-68-L/dTPDC carried out at 120Â°C?
What was the crystal size of UiO-68-NTMB?
Did the synthesis of UiO-68-L/dTPDC involve the use of DMF as a solvent?
What was the effect of temperature on the emission spectra of UiO-68-BTMB/dTPDC?
questions.answer: The emission spectra and transient fluorescence decay profiles of UiO-68-BTMB/dTPDC showed slight changes under different temperatures, indicating a limited temperature effect on the photochemistry.

questions.question: Was the UV-vis absorption spectrum of UiO-68-dTPDC weaker and narrower in the visible-light range compared to UiO-68-NTMB?
What was the purpose of digesting MOF samples with HCl before 1H NMR measurement?
questions.answer: The digestion with HCl was performed to dissolve the MOF structure and release the organic linkers, allowing for the 1H NMR measurement of the linkers in solution.
